title: 'Flame the Jhin, he'll play better!'
body:
I just had the joy of a high elo team in ARAM.

Pretty comfortable with this... but then my family wake up. 

My mom is crying. She had to fix my dad's respirator in the night - she's incredibly tired (she has a chronic fatigue). My dad hears her, comes in, argues. My grandma hears her... it's a family row 5 foot from me.

My play's obviously getting shaky. My team's noticed and are dropping little quips. I've gone from playmaking, and super-clean, to.. 'meh'. Then, my dad (because he's angry) starts watching netflix instead of waiting for 5 more minutes. My ping goes to 300. 

I have been apologizing for playing poorly, and communicating just why I'm playing so poorly. I am still trying my best, because I want to end this game ASAP and go help my family.

The chat's rolling around. I can't pay attention to it, but then I see something odd.
"No, we should flame Jhin because then he'll learn and play better"

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}} 

Yohohoho ok people. I understand you think anything below plat is a smear on a baby's diaper, and it just feeellllss soooo good to rub your shiny border alll over the less shiny borders. But man, you sure are full of **. You've all been playing pretty freakin' poorly with GOOD ping and no drama (Blitzcrank, in bush, notice.)

Yeah, I LEARNT SOMETHING ALRIGHT. The next time I say there's a family issue going on and I'm distracted, and my team starts flaming me regardless, I'm going to go and help the people who actually deserve it. And funnily enough those people aren't the trash-talking stooges who I was randomly assigned to play a super-casual videogame mode with.

replies.body:
First rule

Avoid personal rl anecdotes

It will be harsh, but honestly NOBODY (in game) cares what happens to you. You start playing bad/leave the game, you just ruined the game for the others. That's all.

1. Do not do this. (Yet as i understand, this is a very rare occasion)
2. Just ignore them, mute them and do whatever you feel. (If you want to leave, leave and help the family, but do NOT expect anybody to be happy about it ingame)
3. If this happens often maybe you should not play multiplayer PvP

I just thought it was a ridiculous thing to say when they know the reason someone's playing badly is a family crisis.(dad fall down the stairs, gma set herself on fire... pet vomiting... house stuck by lightning... all real examples). I'm as conscientious as I can be to other players, but life, ah, finds a way.

I think people should apply the golden rule instead of acting like this isn't the case for them, too.

But as I said, the other players play to have fun (not to make you have fun), so if you ruin it for them, they will get upset. Maybe they have struggles in life too, and this game takes them out of their misery for a short time. (Yet YOU, or anyone ruins this short time for the too.) In my opinion your teammates have every right to be upset if you don't play.

But on the other hand, since you know this, and you intentionally ruined their fun (with proper reasons, so im not flaming you now, this is just a fact), you will have to understand that they will be angry. Mute them if they annoy you, but do NOT expect good attitude for anyone who ruins their game.

Sometimes players afk 15 seconds to buy an item, so there must be something else in that "wall of flame" too.

TLDR:
If you ruin the game for anybody, be ready to get flamed. If you cant take it, mute them.

Game wasn't ruined, and remains a videogame. They weren't upset. They were just harassing me for fun.

I guess I made the game better for them, and they made the game worse for me.

{{sticker:sg-ahri-2}}

(I can take it btw, I actually zoned everything out, but that really weird justification for flame caught my eye)

When you say "remains a videogame" anybody else can say, that your harassment remains just characters on the screen.

If you don't care about the first, you should not care about the second either ;)

The most legit reply I've seen.

People will say they shouldn't flame or whatever. But they never thought what happens when somebody else do this to them. Someone afk? REPORT THEM. Someone has more death(bad game due to some whatever reasons as stated in one reply)? REPORT THEM.

If you know it's your fault(again, here by fault I don't mean never have real life problems during game) that ruined others game, just mute :) cuz they're gonna flame.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

Oh, I can imagine that situation. "Hey guys, I've got a family crysis on spot, but don't worry, i'll be here playing a videogame instead of fixing it." 
I myself had an emergency situation only once in many years, simply told my team that I HAD to go afk for 15 minutes, 2 teammates understood and stayed cool and other 2 raged with reports and that's totally fine. Crying that people should value YOUR life over their owns is at the very least really stupid.

> Nobody thinks you're lying, they're just self absorbed and don't care.  Trust me, they are not putting that much thought, or any thought into it besides their own selfishness.

Whatever you want to believe..

It's not belief, it's logic, I work with high risk sex offenders and deal with lying on a continuous basis....for what should be obvious reasons.  If you think strangers have a compelling reason to concoct heartfelt stories over the internet you've either been severely jaded by people, are paranoid, or are not particularly skilled at identifying lying.  And I'm not talking about the people who are obviously making stuff up, I'm talking about the writer of this post who was obviously having a bad day, not the person who has a steady stream of lies intended to boost their image.  People who are motivated to lie are going to do so because they are insecure, or bored, and it will show.  

People who are lying will demonstrate a predictable linear range of responses with language consistent to an argument, not feelings.  It's really phenomenally predictable if you look for seething vitriole, finger-pointing, redirection/ignoring of any questions or points you make, arguments with an easily identifiable purpose such as rambling/boredom/or ego boosting, an unrelenting dedication toward the argument, gaslighting (my personal favorite).  Anytime you see gaslighting assume the person is the spawn of Satan and should no longer be treated with the normal respect you should give a person, and people do it in game all the time.  I find the easiest way to identify a liar is to challenge them, people who are being honest will not have easily predicted responses, liars will resort to the same tactics.

Also dear writer, never project your own moral value system onto other people, it's a really great way to get crapped on.  Like other writers have stated, assume the worst, otherwise you're setting yourself up for failure.  Just remember it's their issue, not some morally ambiguous b.s. about their own personal pity party because you are ruining their game.

I actually care about what happens. If I see someone playing badly, and they say "Shit computer" or "Shit lag", I will believe them. Why? Because I've been there. My computer is a $300 laptop. It was not on sale, and it is nearing 5 years old. It has a CORE i3, and will have random bugs and glitches. One game, every health bar in the game vanished to a 1% visibility for no reason. I had to squint for the entire game to make out health bars, and it took phenomenal effort to even attempt to farm.

This actually happens quite often: IF a notification pops up outside of the league screen for some reason, and the game "closes" while the notification pops up, I have to click on that league icon again. If it's during the load in screen, when the game starts, every upgrade icon will have weird yellow squares going SIDEWAYS, to the left, instead of surrounding the upgrade button. Other changes include lower resolution on the HUD in general, and weird shading.

> No, we should flame Jhin because then he'll learn and play better

So I guess this is the point where I should, say: "this is not okay, players don't learn if you flame them, you are just increasing the emotional stress blah blah whatever"

While I am actually just wondering, since when is flaming so serious and taken so seriously?

So fun fact, in many sports the contracts sports entertainers sign contain rules on how they conduct themselves in whatever sport they are playing which includes a lot of zero tolerance policies.  

On the same line, when you as a player play league of legends you sign a contract, or rather you agree to a ToS, which includes a zero tolerance policy.  

If you think that policy is unreasonable you should consider not playing. Many online multiplayer games have similar zero tolerance policies written into their ToS and Riot Games is basically doing the same thing as many of them.
The mere fact that a policy exists doesn't make it more realistic.
I have literally zero trouble following the policy.  It's not unrealistic at all.
Good for you, but there are also many players who will never do it.

The policy of "be a decent person" is completely reasonable, and people who "will never do it" are people who shouldn't interact with other human beings, period.  People just getting angry in-game isn't actually against the policy, although it's definitely not a good way to vent your frustrations.

Pardon my bluntness; I don't mean to be rude or accuse you, personally, of anything.  But people who can't follow the policy are a detriment to their own enjoyment and others' and would better spend their time elsewhere.

"are people who shouldn't interact with other human beings, period"

Honestly, it's not exactly monumentally difficult to keep playing the game rather than letting your irrational anger spill over the screen like irritable bowel disease.
Teenagers shouldn't interact with human beings. That's what you are saying?

Most teenagers are decent people, so no, that's not at all what I'm saying.  There must be some confusion here.  What part of the policy are you saying a teenager would be unable to follow?  I'm just trying to understand where you're coming from here.
